item.title: A Rally in the British Pound May Be Winding Down
item.description: After a phenomenal run for the British pound, market watchers say the currency’s fortunes could be about to change.

item.title: EUR/USD May Have Peaked at April High of 1.1095 for Now, Charts Show
item.description: EUR/USD may have peaked at the April high of 1.1095 for now, based on technical charts, UOB said, adding that risk for the next two months looks tilted to the downside.

item.title: French Five-Year Government Bonds Look Cheap, Morgan Stanley Says
item.description: The cheapness of some French government bonds offers trading opportunities, Morgan Stanley said, which also keeps its 10-year OAT-Bund compression trade.

item.title: AXA Sales Edge Higher on Demand for Property Policies
item.description: AXA posted a 2% rise in first-quarter revenue, helped by growth at its property and casualty business, and said it was confident of achieving underlying earnings in 2023 of more than €7.5 billion.

item.title: Siemens Energy Cautious on Profit Outlook
item.description: Siemens Energy lifted its full-year revenue growth target but cautioned that its profit margin before special items is now seen around the low end of its guidance range of 1%-3% due to Gamesa’s poor performance

item.title: HSBC Outlines Growth Outlook for Asia Business
item.description: HSBC remained cautious on its Asian business in the short-term, but forecast high-single digit percentage wealth revenue growth in the region over the next three to four years and targeted mid-single digit percentage lending growth over the medium-to-long-term.

item.title: BAT Names News CEO
item.description: British American Tobacco said Tadeu Marroco, currently the company’s finance director, has been appointed as chief executive with immediate effect to succeed Jack Bowles.

item.title: China Sentences American Citizen to Life in Prison for Espionage
item.description: Chinese authorities said they sentenced an American citizen to life in prison on espionage charges, in a case that could further strain relations between Beijing and Washington.

item.title: ING Seen Outperforming ABN AMRO
item.description: Jefferies said it’s time for a performance reversal between ING and ABN AMRO, following the Dutch lenders’ consensus-beating first-quarter results, which led the broker to upgrade its forecasts on net interest income, provisions and costs.

item.title: Oneok agreed to buy Magellan for $14 billion, forming one of the biggest companies involved in transporting and storing energy.
item.description: Oneok agreed to buy Magellan for $14 billion, forming one of the biggest companies involved in transporting and storing energy.

item.title: Biden's new border strategy so far appears to have deterred the record migrant influx many feared following the expiration of Title 42, but the revised system is already proving vulnerable to lawsuits and political attacks from the right and left.
item.description: Biden’s new border strategy so far appears to have deterred the record migrant influx many feared following the expiration of Title 42, but the revised system is already proving vulnerable to lawsuits and political attacks from the right and left.

item.title: Newmont said it agreed to acquire Australia's Newcrest for $17.5 billion, in what would be the largest-ever M&A deal in the gold-mining industry.
item.description: Newmont said it agreed to acquire Australia’s Newcrest for $17.5 billion, in what would be the largest-ever M&A deal in the gold-mining industry.

item.title: Amazon has upended its logistics network to reduce how far packages travel across the U.S. in an effort to get products to customers faster and improve profitability.
item.description: Amazon has upended its logistics network to reduce how far packages travel across the U.S. in an effort to get products to customers faster and improve profitability.

item.title: Companies continue to jack up prices on a range of goods from diapers to handbags and some are bragging about it to investors as a sign of brand strength.
item.description: Companies continue to jack up prices on a range of goods from diapers to handbags and some are bragging about it to investors as a sign of brand strength.

item.title: An Iranian-backed militia in northern Iraq was behind the drone attack that killed a U.S. military contractor in northeast Syria on March 23 and wounded dozens of American civilian and military personnel, U.S. officials said.
item.description: An Iranian-backed militia in northern Iraq was behind the drone attack that killed a U.S. military contractor in northeast Syria on March 23 and wounded dozens of American civilian and military personnel, U.S. officials said.

item.title: Israel and Gaza-based militant group Islamic Jihad agreed to a cease-fire to end five days of intense fighting that had raised fears of a wider conflict.
item.description: Israel and Gaza-based militant group Islamic Jihad agreed to a cease-fire to end five days of intense fighting that had raised fears of a wider conflict.

item.title: The U.S. and its allies are poised to step up pressure on China by rejecting the use of economic retaliation against nations over policy disputes and other disagreements, according to people familiar with the situation.
item.description: The U.S. and its allies are poised to step up pressure on China by rejecting the use of economic retaliation against nations over policy disputes and other disagreements, according to people familiar with the situation.

item.title: Ukraine's President Zelensky vowed to reclaim his entire country while on his first visit to Germany since Russia attacked Ukraine last year.
item.description: Ukraine’s President Zelensky vowed to reclaim his entire country while on his first visit to Germany since Russia attacked Ukraine last year.

item.title: Turkish President Erdogan and his main challenger said they were both prepared to accept a runoff election later this month, with neither claiming an outright victory in a vote that marked the most severe political challenge to the Turkish leader.
item.description: Turkish President Erdogan and his main challenger said they were both prepared to accept a runoff election later this month, with neither claiming an outright victory in a vote that marked the most severe political challenge to the Turkish leader.

item.title: Activist investor Engaged Capital plans to run a proxy fight for three board seats at Shake Shack, according to people familiar with the matter.
item.description: Activist investor Engaged Capital plans to run a proxy fight for three board seats at Shake Shack, according to people familiar with the matter.
